RegionCovered.Title: No exposure detected
RegionCovered.Body: You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

NoRegion.Title: No exposure detected
NoRegion.Body:
You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

However, in some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report COVID-19 diagnoses through this app.

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your province or territory are not yet able to report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

It’s still helpful to turn StopCOVID on. That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll be notified if you were near them.

ExposureDetected.Title: You’ve been exposed
ExposureDetected.Detailed1: You’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app.
ExposureDetected.Detailed2: This does not mean you’ve been infected. But you should probably take some action.

DiagnosedView.Title: Thanks for helping fight COVID

Body1.One: Tomorrow, you’ll get your last notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.
Body1.Other: For the next {number} days, you’ll get a daily notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.

DiagnosedView.Body2: You do not have to agree, even if you agreed the day before. It is your choice.
DiagnosedView.Body3: Take care of yourself and your family during this time.

Home.DailyShareDetailed: Sharing your information helps others to know if they've been exposed to COVID-19. Then they can isolate and slow the spread to others. No details about who you are will be shared.
Home.EnableBluetoothCTA: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so StopCOVID can work.
Home.ExposureNotificationsDisabledDetailed: StopCOVID works by checking these messages.
Home.NoConnectivityDetailed: StopCOVID only checks for exposure if your phone is connected to the Internet.

OverlayOpen.BluetoothCardBody: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so StopCOVID can work.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBody: You were given an 8-digit number when you were diagnosed. This number tells StopCOVID to notify people you were near.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBodyDiagnosed: Thank you for doing your part to stop the spread.
OverlayOpen.NotificationCardBody: You will not receive push notifications if you've been near anyone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis. Finding out potential exposures right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
OverlayOpen.ExposureNotificationCardBody: Exposure notifications are needed for StopCOVID to work.

Tutorial.step-1:
Once you set up StopCOVID, the app runs in the background and will not interrupt your activities.

While you go about your day, your phone uses Bluetooth to send out a random code every 5 minutes. The app changes its random codes frequently, so they cannot be used to identify you.
Tutorial.step-2:
Whenever you’re near someone else who has StopCOVID installed, their phone will also send out random codes that your phone will collect and store. Meanwhile, their phone will collect and store the random codes that your phone sends out.

The phones send codes every 5 minutes. The random codes are stored securely on each phone.
Tutorial.step-3:
The app estimates how far away other phones with StopCOVID are. To do this, it uses the strength of their Bluetooth signals.

If you’re closer than a certain distance for more than a certain amount of time, the app will record an exposure.
Tutorial.step-4:
If someone with the app is diagnosed with COVID-19, they can choose to upload all the codes their phone sent out. The codes go into a central server.

The server only gets the codes. It does not get any information about the person.
Tutorial.step-5:
Every day, whenever it has an Internet connection, your phone will check the server. It gets a list of the random codes that were sent out by phones of people who reported a diagnosis with through the app.

The app deletes the codes it’s collected after 14 days.
Tutorial.step-6:
The app compares the list with the random codes it received from other phones.

If it finds codes that match, it looks to see how strong the Bluetooth signal was and how long you were near them. If the codes match an exposure, the app will let you know that you may have been exposed.

Then you can isolate and read the public health guidance.

Sharing.Title: Tell your friends about StopCOVID
Sharing.SubTitle: Every person using StopCOVID helps to slow the spread of COVID-19. Sharing this app will not share any of your personal information.
Sharing.Message: Join me in helping to slow the spread of COVID-19. Download the StopCOVID app: https://covidshield.app

OnboardingLocation.Title: No location tracking
OnboardingLocation.Intro: StopCOVID does not use GPS or location services. It has no way of knowing:

YourData.Title: Totally anonymous
YourData.Intro: StopCOVID has no way of knowing:
YourData.Body3: any details about you or the people you’re near

OnboardingPermissions.Title: No actions without your permission
OnboardingPermissions.Body1: Nothing is done without your permission.
OnboardingPermissions.Body2: Even when you give permission, StopCOVID only shares the random codes from the phones of people you were near. It does not share any information about you.
OnboardingPermissions.HowItWorksCTA: Read more about how it works

OnboardingStart.Title: What StopCOVID does
OnboardingStart.Body1: It notifies you if someone you’ve been near in the past 14 days reports a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app.
OnboardingStart.Body2: It will not tell you in the moment if you’re currently near someone who’s been diagnosed.
OnboardingStart.Body3: If you test positive for COVID-19, you can anonymously notify others who have been near you, in the past 14 days.
OnboardingStart.Body4: You do not have to use it

ThankYou.Title: Thank you for helping
ThankYou.Body: Exposure notifications are on. You will receive a message if StopCOVID detects that you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.

DataUpload.InfoSmall: Your random IDs will not be shared unless you give permission in the next step.
DataUpload.ConsentTitle: Now you can let StopCOVID notify people
DataUpload.ConsentBody1: StopCOVID will ask your permission to upload your random codes from the past 14 days.
DataUpload.ConsentBody2: Nobody will get any information about you or the time you were near them.
DataUpload.ConsentBody3: It is your choice. You can help slow the spread of COVID-19 if you agree.
DataUpload.ErrorBody: Your StopCOVID code could not be recognized. Please try again.

Step1.Title: Enter your 8-digit number
Step1.Body:
You should have been given an 8-digit number when you were diagnosed. You need to enter this number if you want StopCOVID to let people know they were exposed.

This is optional. It’s your choice. But you can help slow the spread of COVID-19 if you do it.

NoRegion.Title: You skipped choosing province or territory
NoRegion.Body:
In some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

To find out if you can get an 8-digit number, you need to choose your area.

RegionCovered.Title: No 8-digit number?
RegionCovered.Body: Contact the person or office that gave you your results to get a number.

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your province or territory are not yet able to report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

You will not be able to notify people you’ve been near that they were exposed. But you can still take steps to:
RegionNotCovered.Body3: protect people and pets you live with.

Notification.ExposedMessageBody:
You’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app.

This does not mean you’ve been infected. But you should probably take some action.
Notification.OffMessageBody: Turn on StopCOVID to get notified if you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationTitle: Share your new informatin about people you were near
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationBody: Sharing your information helps people know if they've been exposed to COVID-19. Then they can isolate and slow the spread to others. No details about who you are will be shared.

BottomSheet.OnStatus: StopCOVID is on, Tap for more information
BottomSheet.OffStatus: StopCOVID is off, Tap for more information

RegionPicker.Title: Where do you live?
RegionPicker.Body:
Choose the province or territory whose public health guidance you need to follow.

This information is only stored on your phone and will never be shared with anyone.
